name: slimily
content:
slimily adverb
(STICKY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a slimy (= covered in a sticky liquid substance that is unpleasant to touch) way: The slug slithered slimily down the windscreen. The sweets stuck slimily to the roof of her mouth.
More examplesFewer examplesThe pebbles underfoot were slimily warm.The melon balls rolled slimily around the plate.

slimily adverb
(BEHAVIOUR)
in a way that appears to be friendly but that you find unpleasant: "I need you to come closer my dear," he said slimily. In the production he played a slimily elegant king.
More examplesFewer examplesHer slimily unpleasant uncle told her that she would make a fine wife for someone.He smiled slimily across at her.
